title: Elihu: God’s Majesty in the Storm
summary: Elihu describes the majesty of God seen in nature—lightning, thunder, snow, and storms. He emphasizes God’s power, wisdom, and sovereignty, preparing the way for God’s direct response to Job.

faq.question: What does Elihu say about God’s control over nature?
faq.answer: That God commands all elements—storms, snow, rain—as part of His purposes.

faq.question: How does this chapter set the stage for what comes next?
faq.answer: It shifts the focus from human reasoning to God’s awesome power—God Himself is about to speak.
